title: (x) Vintage French 1930s lettering - hand lettered, Sphinx {Christopher Short, Mark S}
content:
The following examples are from a french architecture book from the 1930s. Arer these commercial typefaces, or hand lettering? Any ideas are appreciated.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110205041146im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lettering1_5977.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110205041146im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lettering2_5656.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110205041146im_/http:/typophile.com/files/lettering3_5091.jpg)
author: dpl

comments.content: The top two examples look hand-made to me. The bottom sample has more consistency through the forms which make me think it's a typeface.

The one at the bottom is [Sphinx](http://web.archive.org/web/20110205041146/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/redrooster/sphinx-rr/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D57%26w%3D720%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DL%25E2%2580%2599ARCHITECTURE%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dot.liga%26seed%3D28). I agree that the other two were hand lettered.
I love the first one. beautiful stuff

Thanks for the input, especially in identifying the Sphinx, Mark. I was pretty certain the center one was hand lettered, but I thought the top one (my favorite) might be a typeface, although I do see some small inconsistencies in the ends of the strokes.
